author: pandas9
content: I've used mew wallet to send $15 worth of eth and paid $200 in gas fees https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe7f2996248ef41122e9482aeeb8846d763c9dd1160160bbf975a0d5afd6d071b

author: pandas9
content: Is there a way to avoid this?

author: pandas9
content: Wasn't london upgrade supposed to make this obsolete?

author: pandas9
content:
Also looking at eth gas fee docs there is statement about gas fees
"Additionally, Jordan can also set a max fee (maxFeePerGas) for the transaction. The difference between the max fee and the actual fee is refunded to Jordan, i.e. refund = max fee - (base fee + priority fee). Jordan can set a maximum amount to pay for the transaction to execute and not worry about overpaying "beyond" the base fee when the transaction is executed."

author: sky.cactus
content: This isn't the right place for that type of question.  This is a research discord server, where we discuss future potential changes and upgrades to Ethereum.

author: pandas9
content: This is off topic dev, if you want upgrades to eth take a look at eth providers

author: pandas9
content: Since google search such as "ethereum set max gas fees" offers nothing to normal users
